item.title: January Windows updates may fail if Citrix SRA is installed
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft is warning that the January 2025 Windows 11 and Windows 10 cumulative updates may fail if Citrix Session Recording Agent (SRA) version 2411 is installed on the device. [...]

item.title: Allstate car insurer sued for tracking drivers without permission
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has filed a lawsuit against Allstate and its data subsidiary Arity for unlawfully collecting, using, and selling driving data from over 45 million Americans. [...]

item.title: WP3.XYZ malware attacks add rogue admins to 5,000+ WordPress sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new malware campaign has compromised more than 5,000 WordPress sites to create admin accounts, install a malicious plugin, and steal data. [...]

item.title: US govt says North Korea stole over $659 million in crypto last year
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​North Korean state-backed hacking groups have stolen over $659 million worth of cryptocurrency in multiple crypto-heists, according to a joint statement issued by the United States, South Korea, and Japan on Tuesday. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5049981 update released with new BYOVD blocklist
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5049981 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which contains an updated Kernel driver blocklist to prevent Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft January 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 8 zero-days, 159 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's January 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 159 flaws, including eight zero-day vulnerabilities, with three actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5050009 & KB5050021 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released the Windows 11 KB5050009 and KB5050021 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Google OAuth flaw lets attackers gain access to abandoned accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A weakness in Google's OAuth "Sign in with Google" feature could enable attackers that register domains of defunct startups to access sensitive data of former employee accounts linked to various software-as-a-service (SaaS) platforms. [...]

item.title: FBI deletes Chinese PlugX malware from thousands of US computers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The U.S. Department of Justice announced today that the FBI has deleted Chinese PlugX malware from over 4,200 computers in networks across the United States. [...]

item.title: Hackers use FastHTTP in new high-speed Microsoft 365 password attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are utilizing the FastHTTP Go library to launch high-speed brute-force password attacks targeting Microsoft 365 accounts globally. [...]

item.title: Fortinet warns of auth bypass zero-day exploited to hijack firewalls
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Attackers are exploiting a new authentication bypass zero-day vulnerability in FortiOS and FortiProxy to hijack Fortinet firewalls and breach enterprise networks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 apps crash on Windows Server after Office update
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft says a known issue is causing Classic Outlook and Microsoft 365 applications to crash on Windows Server 2016 or Windows Server 2019 systems. [...]

item.title: OneBlood confirms personal data stolen in July ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Blood-donation not-for-profit OneBlood confirms that donors' personal information was stolen in a ransomware attack last summer. [...]
